attributes.action: Stop expenses and reduce the £91,346 pay that MP earn
attributes.additional_details: As Labour stated that the finances are in disarray as they "inherited" from the last government. They need to look into their own government spending as the Prime Minister have said that we should all be in this together and tough times are ahead for everyone. Lately I haven't heard any news of MPs being affected by cuts.
attributes.background: To review all expenses by MPs this means every claim they put under expenses and to cut down the £91,346 pay that they earn. Surely this will reduce the £24 billion black hole labour keeps reminding us of.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/

You may wish to sign this petition calling for a review of MP’s expenses:

Review the system of expenses and allowances for MPs
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/702821
